text: Jim Colbert (born c. 1948) is a former American football player and coach. He served as the head football coach at C. W. Post—now known as LIU Post—in Brookville, New York from 1980 to 1982, compiling a record of 15–16. Colbert attended Neshaminy High School in Langhorne, Pennsylvania and was the starting quarterback at the University of Delaware in 1970 before switching to wide receiver. He was head football coach at Smyrna High School in Smyrna, Delaware from 1972 to 1975, tallying a mark of 30–21–1, before he was hired as the offensive coordinator at Davidson College in 1976. ==References== Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:1940s births Category:Living people Category:American football quarterbacks Category:American football wide receivers Category:Davidson Wildcats football coaches Category:Delaware Fightin' Blue Hens football players Category:LIU Post Pioneers football coaches Category:High school football coaches in Delaware Category:People from Langhorne, Pennsylvania Category:People from Levittown, Pennsylvania Category:Players of American football from Pennsylvania
title: Jim Colbert (American football)
